description: Worked fine a few weeks ago but now nothing happens when trying to import an STL
tree supports make it worth it!
Crashes when you select resize
I use it for slicing for my Ender 3 Max. Works well with easy to use interface.
It runs flawless in Fedora34!

the tab of choose material dont show, anything.
if i install a new material from markeplace it dont show in the tab.

if i use appimage all the things work normally
Crashes alot...

I am a novice content creator using Freecad to produce STL's and slice in Cura.
The app works as expected.
I tweak a lot in advanced settings and have not had any problems.
Running on an Acer Swift 3 with a Ryzen 5 5500U and with onboard gfx Lucienne (rev c2) 256M (Mid/Low end laptop)
Look forward to the next release.
summary: Works great on Ubuntu 22.04 with an Acer swift 3

description: It is outdated, it crashes or freezes every single time.
It crashes too much. If you get to slice something before it crashes it does the job. But god forbid you try to add a custom filament setting or anything else remotely advanced...

Open file menu does nothing.
Fixing permissions with flatseal does not help. 

Even if you manage to open your stl file with drag n drop - save gcode file do nothing. So it is unusable right now on any linux.

Works fine for me. Opens stl files and saves gcode fine. 
BUT i cannot install plugins. 
1: It proceeds to download them and ask you to restart Cura. But the plugin is not installed. It continues to ask for a sync where it will download and "install" and ask for a restart again. 
Goto 1

Cura itself is great. An easy-to-use slicer, while also being fairly powerful, and with good plugins. However, this repackaged version is, as of the time of writing, about 9 months behind current updates (including a major update; Cura 4 -> 5), so I'd recommand using the AppImage from Ultimaker's website instead.
I can open STL's from File Explorers or in the App, i also can install Plugins (tried MeshTools) and save the Gcode without issues.
Viele Plugins laden garnicht oder arbeiten bescheiden. aber immerhin läufts auf der kleinsten Krücke flüssig
Why isn't this being updated?
Since updating to Fedora 38 Cura has become unusable. It crashes within seconds
didnt load didnt load
works fine except for some plugins that are unable to load
summary: works fine except for some plugins

description: Installed octoprint plugin and was able to send a job to the printer. Will keep testing for slicing speed and such. But I'll keep using it instead of the appimage for now.
crashes repeatedly, settings windows are all independent and can't be closed.... pronterface is working better for now. trying slic3r next
Works well with no issues

As of this date the current Cura version is 5.6.0
This version won't work with most printers from the last several years.
this version does not seem to have an elegoo category in the printer selection.
Does everything I need a slicer to do with no problems. I use the sovol cura 6 plus.

Older version with no support for newer printers. Program asks me to remove plugins then restart cura to complete the removal process but doesn't seem to remove them.
Downloaded the current version appimage via the Ultimaker website and had no issues.
Works great in Ubuntu with my Ender 3v2!

Cura always seemed a little "unstable" for me, but the current version both the rpm and flatpak are at is at times mostly unusable. Selecting what PLA to use crashes the app. The menu bar becomes unresponsive and then crashes the app. Moving around too fast crashes the app.

Flatpak maintainers are having issues building the new 5.0 version see here: https://github.com/flathub/com.ultimaker.cura/pull/5

Once that's resolved I will return, but for now I would suggest either using the AppImage or use the superior Slic3r instead.
crasheses in about 30 secounds from lauch
summary: cant even setup before it crashes

description: It's great and complicated software, with lots of tweeks and fidgets. Reading other reviews and seeing so many "crash" one stars, got me thinking. I had more crashes on google chrome then on Cura.

Cura is great when it works but unfortunately the flatpak builds of the last couple of versions all had major flaws (random crashes, typos in gcode commands, uneditable material forms), that made it a hassle to use. I was pretty happy with the Cura 4.x builds that I installed from from the rpm repos but didn't want to wait forever for Cura 5. I would much appreciate if the flatpak builds would get a bit more attention or the later versions would be released in the repos as well, so that Cura could shine like it should since it is actually really great software.

Started by trying out the RPM version and encountered too many bugs. E.g. the area of the screen where I could see/interact with the print was a quarter the size it should be, anytime I tried to move/rotate the print it would deselect it, the text was very low resolution until I hovered over it, etc. 

Flatpak version worked perfectly out of the box.
Closed right after startup.

I was really glad they finally got it updated to the recent version. Thanks for that! 

Opened fine in the first few uses, but had many bugs, e.g. it crashed randomly to desktop and didn't slice when selecting the 3D-cross infill.

Now it doesn't open anymore, only showing the starting logo.
Will use the Flatpak for now instead.
summary: Worked fine initially, but now doesn't open anymore

Cela bug au niveau des fenêtres, sur les menus supérieurs et impossible de choisir un menu avec la sourie. impossible de travailler correctement avec et donc à éviter pour le moment, que l'interface soit compatible avec Gnome.

Les mises à jours pour Fedora ne sont pas rapide et cela ne stimule pas à l'utiliser.

C'est pour cela que je lui donne la note en dessous de la moyenne, peut-être avec une bonne mise à jour, ce bug sera réglé, mais quand ?

Heureusement qu'il y a PrulaSlicer qui fonctionne bien sous Fedora et je trouve supérieur à Cura.
summary: Cela bug et impossible de travailler avec, sous Fedora 34
